organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: Perioperative Warming Measures in Cesarean Delivery
identificationModule.officialTitle: Randomized Control Trial Assessing Effectiveness of Perioperative Warming Measures in Parturients Undergoing Cesarean Delivery

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the best method for keeping patients warm during cesarean deliveries and the effect of temperature change on the patient and baby

armGroups.label: Treatment
armGroups.description:
Preop: Use of full body forced air warming pre-operative at ambient (32˚C) for at least 30 minutes and fluids from warmed cabinet set at 45˚C

Intraop: Use of upper body and lower forced air warming intra-operative at 32 and 42˚C respectively and IV fluids with hotline fluid warmer set at 42˚C
interventionNames: Device: Pre op upper body forced air warming (32˚C)
Device: Pre op lower body forced air warming (32˚C)
Device: Intra op upper body forced air warming (32˚C)
Device: Intra op upper body forced air warming at (32˚C)
Device: Intra op upper body forced air warming at (42˚C)
Device: Intra op lower body forced air warming at (32˚C)
Device: Intra op lower body forced air warming at (42˚C)

armGroups.label: Control Group
armGroups.description:
Preop: Use of full body forced air warming pre-operative at ambient (32˚C) for at least 30 minutes and fluids from warmed cabinet set at 45˚C

Intraop: Use of upper body forced air warming intra-operative at ambient (32˚C) and IV fluids at room temperature
interventionNames: Device: Pre op upper body forced air warming (32˚C)
Device: Pre op lower body forced air warming (32˚C)
Device: Intra op upper body forced air warming (32˚C)
Device: Intra op fluids at room temperature
Device: Intra op upper body forced air warming at (32˚C)

interventions.description: lower body forced air warming at ambient (32˚C) for at least 30 minutes

Intra op upper body forced air warming at (32˚C)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in maternal core body temperature
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: preoperative/beginning of surgery ,postoperative/end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)

primaryOutcomes.description: Hypothermia is indicated as core temperature \< 36 °C
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: preoperative/beginning of surgery ,postoperative/end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Neonate status as determined by Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, and Respiration (APGAR) score
primaryOutcomes.description: Five criteria are scored and each one is scored form 0-2 with a total score of 10, a higher score indicating a better outcome.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Neonate status as determined by Umbilical Artery PH

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Degree of shivering is measured from 0(no shivering)-3(total body shivering)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: on arrival to Post anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) [about 4 hours after anesthesia]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients that need meperidine
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: on arrival to PACU [about 4 hours after anesthesia]

secondaryOutcomes.description: Degree of shivering is measured from 0(no shivering)-3(total body shivering)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients that need meperidine

secondaryOutcomes.description: Degree of shivering is measured from 0(no shivering)-3(total body shivering)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: after administration of meperidine, if it applies (about 30 minutes in PACU)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients that show Maternal thermal comfort
secondaryOutcomes.description: scored form 0-10,a higher number indicating more thermal comfort
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)
end of surgery (4 hours ater anesthesia)
Time of admission to time of discharge (about 72 hours after surgery)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* scheduled for elective cesarean section under neuraxial anesthesia
* singleton pregnancy

Exclusion Criteria:

* gestational age of less than 37 week
* emergency cesarean

overallOfficials.name: Stacy Norrell, MD
